alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 1:49PM MDT until April 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Significant amounts of agricultural lands are flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 15.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening by 1100 PM CDT.
